results.title: Teenage pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward and Hector Lemieux
results.brief_description: Shows the reaction of a family when one of the daughters reveals that she is pregnant. Presents the decisions to be made concerning both the mother-to-be and the coming child, ignoring the responsibility of the father and concentrating on the girl’s problem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sterling Educational Films, Moreland-Latchford Productions, Joe Hayward and Hector Lemieux

results.title: Teenage movies in competition
results.brief_description: Contains excerpts from twelve award-winning films made by young filmmakers “out to communicate ideas…to make a personal statement… to examine a civic problem…to educate or just to have fun.” All films submitted for the “Teenage Movies Competition” run by Kodak.

results.title: Teenage girl
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, Basic Films, Leon Clore and Sam Napier-Bell
results.brief_description: A sixteen-year-old girl’s interests and successive choices of careers are shown humorously. Indicates the opportunities waiting for school-leavers of both sexes.

results.title: Teenage crises: fateful choices
results.creator_credit: Human Relations Media, Linda Atkinson and Nick Doob
results.brief_description: This hard-hitting documentary addresses many of the significant problems encountered by today’s youth: addiction, violence, pregnancy, AIDS and depression/suicide. “Teenage crises” attempts to shake up the notion of teen invincibility by talking to young people who have come through hard times, including Olympic gold medal swimmer Nelson Deibel, an ex-drug addict. Stresses the importance of finding positive role models and being secure enough to make the right choices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Human Relations Media, Linda Atkinson and Nick Doob
results.description: This hard-hitting documentary addresses many of the significant problems encountered by today’s youth: addiction, violence, pregnancy, AIDS and depression/suicide. “Teenage crises” attempts to shake up the notion of teen invincibility by talking to young people who have come through hard times, including Olympic gold medal swimmer Nelson Deibel, an ex-drug addict. results.title: Teenage Babylon
results.brief_description: Restaging 1950s and 1960s forensic photographs, director Graeme Wood explores the meanings, memories and possible stories that were undetected at the time. These intimate and poetic portraits reveal how the distance of time itself alters and reconfigures the actual space and meaning of the photograph.

results.title: Teen suicide
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Research Group Limited, Charlotte Angel, Kyle Boyd and Matt Clark
results.brief_description: This program looks at the reasons troubled teenagers consider, attempt or commit suicide. There is an emphasis on recognising the warning signs, the importance of communication, preventative measures and where to go to help. The program features interviews with teenagers who offer insights into the reasons why they felt suicidal and how they dealt with their situations.

results.title: Teddy bears at play [1959]
results.creator_credit: Australian National Travel Association, Mel F. Nichols and Winifred Lade
results.brief_description: A re-issue of a 1939 film, famous for its intimate study of the koala. This quaint and friendly creature with its soft round furry body is the most popular of Austrlia’s unique animals. Photographed by Mel. F. Nichols, edited by Winifred Lade.
